semantic_title: Use of Undetermined Intent External Cause Codes
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 20. Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > h. Unknown or Undetermined Intent Guideline > 1) Use of undetermined intent

content.full_text: External cause codes for events of undetermined intent are only for use if the documentation in the record specifies that the intent cannot be determined. (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)
content.summary: Undetermined intent codes require specific documentation stating intent cannot be determined (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)
key_concepts: Undetermined intent codes have specific documentation requirements (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)
Documentation must explicitly state intent cannot be determined (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use undetermined intent codes only when documentation specifies intent cannot be determined (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)
detailed_rules.explanation: These codes are reserved for cases where the medical record explicitly documents that the intent of the injury cannot be determined, not simply when intent is not mentioned (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)
common_applications: Cases with explicit documentation of undetermined intent

workflow_steps: Step 1: Look for explicit documentation about intent determination
Step 2: Verify documentation states intent cannot be determined
Step 3: Only then use undetermined intent codes

coding_scenarios.scenario: Medical record explicitly states that intent of injury cannot be determined after investigation
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient injury - intent cannot be determined despite investigation
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify explicit documentation about intent determination
Step 2: Confirm documentation states intent cannot be determined
Step 3: Use appropriate undetermined intent external cause code

correct_coding.rationale: Documentation explicitly states intent cannot be determined (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)

incorrect_coding.code: Undetermined intent code when intent simply not mentioned
incorrect_coding.rationale: Requires explicit documentation that intent cannot be determined
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using undetermined intent when intent is simply not documented

warnings: Only use when documentation explicitly states intent cannot be determined (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)
best_practices: Look for specific language about intent determination in documentation (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)
common_mistakes: Using undetermined intent codes when intent is simply not mentioned (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)
tips: Distinguish between 'not documented' and 'cannot be determined' (Evidence: pg no: 91, L27)
